content:
This is the abstract. This article will describe the eLife article and the process.
                    An abstract can contain any formatting, such as italics,
                        bold, superscript, subscript or small caps. MathML is
                    also allowed: 
                    



m




p


m

=
0




                . eLife does not structure abstracts into sub headings expect in a clinical trial article, but the abstract can have
                    multiple paragarahs. The sub DOI is always .001 as it is the first asset in any
                    article. I have added an unmatched > bracket as this has been an issue for PubMed deposits in the past. If this was a clinical trial the clinical trial details would be listed at the end of the abstract: Clinical trial Registration: EudraCT2004-000446-20.
full_content:
This is the abstract. This article will describe the eLife article and the process. An abstract can contain any formatting, such as italics, bold, superscript, subscript or small caps. MathML is also allowed: m p m = 0 .

eLife does not structure abstracts into sub headings expect in a clinical trial article, but the abstract can have multiple paragarahs. The sub DOI is always .001 as it is the first asset in any article. I have added an unmatched > bracket as this has been an issue for PubMed deposits in the past.

If this was a clinical trial the clinical trial details would be listed at the end of the abstract:

Clinical trial Registration: EudraCT2004-000446-20.

content:
eLife digest are now optional and not every research article will contain one.
                    These are layman abstracts, designed for non-specialists in this field to be
                    able to understand this article, as well as the general public. Here is paragraph 2 of the digest.
full_content:
eLife digest are now optional and not every research article will contain one. These are layman abstracts, designed for non-specialists in this field to be able to understand this article, as well as the general public.

Here is paragraph 2 of the digest.
title: eLife digest
